oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Interview with Umm Mīlād
مقابلة مع أم ميلاد
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Short stories, Arabic--Palestine
Popular literature--Palestine
oai_dc:dc.dc:otherSubject: al-Shāṭir Muḥammad; Children; Conduct of life; Disguise; Escape; Girls; Ḥaj; Horses; Hospitality; Hunting; Hyenas; Killing; Marriage; Shepherds; Sisters; Trees; Water resources; al-Shāṭir Muḥammad; Camels; Caves; Celebrations; Education; Elderly people; Emotions; Family reunification; Floods; Hospitality; Marriage; Newly weds; Parents; Rain; Shepherds; Wedding celebration; Wives; Building practices; Cats; Children; Cooking; Dhabīḥah; Dwellings; Egypt; Farm animals; Hospitality; Invocation; Landowners; Princes; Shaykhs; Travel; Work; Birds; Boats; Children; Cities and towns; Complaints; Daughters; Diseases; Disguise; Fiancés; Friendship; Hospitality; Jewels; Knights; Marriage; Nation; Popular tales; Return; Shepherds; Village leaders
oai_dc:dc.dc:biography: The interview was recorded with Umm Mīlād, female, born in 1940 in Wādī al-Ḥundāj, Palestine and resides in al-Baddāwī Palestinian Refugee Camp, Lebanon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:biographyAR: سجلت المقابلة مع أم ميلاد ، أنثى، ولدت عام 1940 في وادي الحنداج، فلسطين وتقيم في مخيم البداوي للاجئين الفلسطينيين، لبنان.
